intro: Camaridium carinulatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed camaridium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has slender, upright stems. Its small, white or greenish flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. The leaves are narrow and often have a slight serration along the edges.
